channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: By listening to these birds for decades, scientists track signs of a changing forest
item.description: Scientists tracking the birds in an experimental forest in New Hampshire have also tracked changes in the forest ecosystem over decades.

item.title: Greetings from a peaceful woodland near the River Thames west of London
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Israel targets Hamas Qatar strike. And, JB Pritzker on Trump's threats to Chicago
item.description: Israel says it carried out an airstrike targeting senior Hamas officials in Qatar's capital of Doha. And, Trump says he wants to fight crime in Illino...

item.title: California considers allowing doctors to prescribe abortion drugs anonymously
item.description: If passed, the law would protect doctors from legal risk by letting them omit their names from prescription labels for abortion pills. It would affect...

item.title: Dr. Peter Hotez takes the war against science very personally
item.description: In an interview about the new book he co-authored, Science Under Siege, Hotez talks about forces driving the anti-science movement, the risks it poses...

item.title: 9/10: CBS Morning News
item.description: Poland says it shot down Russian drones that entered its airspace during Russian attack on Ukraine; Major U.S. jobs revisions point to weak labor mark...

item.title: Poland says it shot down Russian drones after airspace violation
item.description: Nato jets were also deployed to respond to drones that entered Polish airspace during Russian strikes on Ukraine.

item.title: Protests hit France as new PM takes office
item.description: A grassroots movement is encouraging people to protest against the political class and proposed budget cuts.

item.title: What are the 6 things that Original Medicare won't cover?
item.description: Original Medicare leaves major gaps in coverage that could result in thousands worth of out-of-pocket costs.

item.title: Shock as Kenyan lawyer killed in drive-by shooting in Nairobi
item.description: Kyalo Mbobu was driving home when a gunman on a motorbike shot him dead on a busy street in the capital.

item.title: From slavery to pollution, National Park employees flagged material deemed ‘disparaging’ to US
Uber plans to let customers book helicopter rides through its app
item.description: Uber is teaming with electric air taxi maker Joby to bring helicopter service to its ride-sharing platform as soon as 2026.

item.title: Trump escalates attacks on Bureau of Labor Statistics amid jobs report revisions
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics revised its jobs report to show that the U.S. added 911,000 fewer jobs than previously reported between March 2024 and ...

item.title: Jihadists 'summarily executed' 127 people in Niger, says rights group
item.description: Worshippers have been gunned down in mosques and homes have been torched in escalating violence, Human Rights Watch says.

item.title: NATO, White House address Russian drones violating Poland's airspace
item.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte and the White House addressed Russia's violation of Poland's airspace during its attack on Ukraine. CBS News' Ramy I...

item.title: Chinese nationals jailed for human trafficking in South Africa
item.description: A raid on a Johannesburg factory found 91 Malawians, including 37 children, living in appalling conditions.

item.title: Man faces federal charge in killing of Ukrainian woman on Charlotte train
item.description: The Justice Department has charged a man with the fatal stabbing of a Ukrainian refugee on a North Carolina commuter train.

item.title: Plans in the works for Korean workers detained in raid to go home while fear lingers for residents
